text: White. pristine, empty frame.   Clean and peaceful.
Heaven is a place where nothing ever happens.

There's gentle motion in the blank frame, like swirling 1 grain. A RUMBLE starts to build, low but growing louder.. The grain moves faster, big chunks fluttering, now a dirt dishwater grey. The RUMBLE becoming a HOWLING WIND. Churning black water LAPS at the bottom of the frame...
A blizzard, at the peak of its power. Visibility zero, Ne York reduced to the hulking shapes of buildings on the ba MAX PAYNE thrashes in the water, a long way from shore.
There's an army of bodies under this river. Criminals, people who ran out of time, out of friends.
Chunks of ice float in the dirty water around him. Max's body freezing, skin turning blue. Heavy winter clothes saturating, like an anchor dragging him down...
The next time they drag this river, they'll find me on the bottom with the rest of them. And there won't be anybody left to say I was different.
Max's face sinks below the surface...
Nothing to orient us to the location, the time. Just a fl of golden light filling the hall, warm as the river was c Around a closed door, sunlight streams through the gaps..

A WOMAN sleeps on the bed, curled up around a bundled BAB Is this the final, peaceful memory of a drowning man? Something's wrong, then: the woman's body in an unnatural position, more thrown than laid across the bed. The crib tipped over, blankets scattered. Her eyes frozen open. Something BLACK flutters against the window pane, CRACKIN into the glass. The sound of the BLIZZARD creeps in...
Wind POUNDS the river where Max had once been, but there' more thrashing in the water. Mixed in behind the falling snowflakes, BLACK SHAPES swirl and dive closer to the wat
I could feel the dead down there, just below my feet. Reaching up to welcome me as one of their own.
Max breaks the surface - GASPING, STRUGGLING against the undertow. Not simply trying to breathe...trying to swim.
It was an easy mistake to make.

Abruptly, the snow is gone. Just a bitter wind left in it place, whipping through desolate streets long after midni Shuffling up the littered sidewalk, three rough-looking M duck out of the wind by descending down to the subway... On the dark side of the street, a pair of BOOTS follows t

A filthy platform, empty except for the three Men huddled a bench. A squeaking TURNSTILE catches their ear... The same boots grind towards the Men. We don't see the walker's face, distracted by something else: a gleaming g wristwatch. As if to make certain the Men notice, he pull back his sleeve to check the time. Quarter past three... The watch glints as it passes into a dark doorway marked `MEN'S.' The Men follow, exchanging wicked grins. Too eas
The Men slink into the bathroom, smirking at their oblivi prey at the sink. Steam rising, he sets the watch on the edge of the sink before washing his hands...
Hey, that's a really nice watch.

No answer. One of the Men LOCKS the door.       At the so the lock SNAPPING, he raises his head... Max Payne, but not yet the man struggling for life in the river: clean-shaven, skin like bleached bone. Haunted eye In the murky mirror, Max sees the Men circling closer...
(drooling over the watch) Kinda reminds me of one I lost--
You didn't lose it. You pawned it up on 128th a few hours ago.
Max shuts off the water and calmly turns to face them.
(nodding to Man #2) Ask Doug. He was there with you.
Doug frowns, deeply confused about being called by his na
You've been following us all night?
No. (pointing) I'm only following you.
While Doug digests that, PAWNSHOP pulls a pistol and trai it on Max's forehead. The third man - not much more than KID, visibly frightened - backs towards the door.
You a cop, or something?
Not tonight.
Too bad. (to Doug) Go get my watch.

Distractedly eyeballing Max, Doug brushes the watch off o the sink. It hits the dirty tile, delicate crystal CRACKI In a sudden blur of movement, Max has one hand on the pis the other one SMASHING into Pawnshop's windpipe... Doug steps forward to help... BOOM! The pistol goes off a Max pries it free. Max looks up at Doug. Nowhere to run, races into the farthest stall and SLAMS the door. In the same instant, the Kid bolts for the door. Max has pick: follow or stay with the man he's tracking... In the stall, Doug crawls on his stomach across the stick floor, trying to squeeze under the divider. Max raises th pistol and BLASTS a hole through the door of the next sta
(craving, eyes closed) Watch over me, watch over me...
The newly-perforated door flies open. Handcuffs SNAP, restraining a WHIMPERING Doug to the toilet pipe.
Open your eyes, now.
Doug finds himself staring at the pistol's front sight. M reaches into his pocket and produces a tattered photograp It's the woman from Max's golden vision in the river.
Have you ever seen her before?
Doug shakes his head violently, confusion and terror risi
You got busted robbing a house in New Jersey with William Preston three--
Bill's dead.
That's why I'm talking to you. (moving the photo closer) Did he ever say anything about this woman? Did you ever hear anyone--
Bill died because their wings couldn't lift him up.
No, he got shot robbing a liquor store. What are you talking about?
(incoherent, rambling) Their wings are golden, the feathers only look black...
Sighing, Max unlocks Doug from the pipe, hauling him up a slamming into the wall as he cuffs his hands behind his b
Max stalks out of the bathroom, pushing Doug ahead of him Down on the tracks, the Kid shrinks into the shadows...

The Kid runs down the dark tracks, nervously glancing bac the receding light of the platform.   He slows gradually, relaxing as escape seems certain. Down to a walk, he startles at movement in the tunnel ahe FLAPPING WINGS - a bird, lost and trapped underground? The Kid freezes, his frightened BREATHS almost enough to drown the sound out. It grows, though, more WINGS joining He turns to retreat up the tracks, but the WINGS suddenly seem to be echoing towards him from all directions. Panicked, the Kid becomes disoriented in the growing RACK the tunnel ahead begins to glow brighter as he spins... Visible now in the growing light, BLACK SHAPES flicker ab the tracks - dozens becoming hundreds, swelling larger, t POUNDING wings joined by a train RUMBLING closer...
Frozen, the Kid can only squint into the headlights closi in, petrified by the dark wings SWIRLING around him...

The front room of the cold case department is a mess - de piled high with paperwork and a week's worth of coffee cu Halfway in the front door, a young DETECTIVE stands holdi box of his belongings. He looks around for signs of life. SERGEANT ADAMS wanders down the hall, frowning at the dra
You my new guy?
I didn't think anybody was here.
Everybody's usually a little late.
Sgt. Adams leads the detective down a hall, giving the to
All the cold investigations in the city are collected and delivered over to us. We call each witness to see if they can add anything to their original statement.
And if they can?
We send the file back to the original precinct for follow-up. Don't get your hopes up, though.
The Sergeant continues towards the center of the building farther from the light of the windows. He stops at a door
Once you've gone through the file and come up empty, bring it here...
They enter a windowless cave, long rows of metal cabinets stretching on forever into the heart of the building. At desk in the corner, Max slumps over a stack of files.
Max here handles our filing. Once it hits his desk, a case is officially dead.
ax looks up, dark circles from his long night in the subw He nods, but the Detective is too busy making a note to s
What if there's no phone number for a witness? Should I follow up in person?
Nope, we don't do that down here.
iscretely, Max slides his cut-up knuckles under the desk.
I don't understand, then how--
How do you solve that unsolvable murder mystery and redeem yourself?
The grand jury couldn't find--
Stop. Trust me, there's a tragic story behind why I'm here giving you this tour. We all did something, so just save it. (moving for the door) Follow me to the break room...
The Detective turns to Max, embarrassed after his reprima
We should get a beer after work, or something...
Max smiles and nods, but his eyes give him away as a liar
Yeah.   Maybe so.
The Detective steals a look at Max as Adams shuts his doo
So what did he do?
J
(sharply) Nothing.
Naturally, this reaction piques the detective's curiosity
R emember when you were a kid, and you'd hold your breath when you went past a graveyard?
The detective nods.     Adams glances through the window
ust...try to leave him alone.

Max sneaks a sideways glance to the door, watching Adams the new Detective away. Once they're gone, Max reaches in his desk and removes a file... `PRESTON, WILLIAM A.' ax goes to a rusted cabinet and buries the file deep insi

A lock POPS.     Max steps inside, only silence to greet Max lays his jacket across the back of a worn leather cha footsteps REVERBERATING because there's little other furniture to absorb the sound. He keeps walking...
...past a table with one chair, past gleaming counters. M fills a glass of water from the tap. Eyes blank, patient.

Carefully, Max rests the full glass on the arm of the cha Reaching underneath the chair, Max produces an artist's sketchbook and places it delicately on the table before h Sith trembling hands, Max turns back the battered cover.. uddenly, colors burst into the monochrome room: bright swirls of oil pastels sketch out a still life in Technico Gradually, Max's eyes lose their hardness. His breaths co FASTER, ragged. Jaw clenched, he turns the page...

More flowing brush strokes, the artist's feminine initial Max reaches up to turn the page, hands shaking severely.. He takes hold of the corner of the page, but his muscles won't cooperate - as if the page ways more than Max can l Max's skin flushes red...tears almost welling... And then at once, Max slams the book shut and turns away.

The door swings open. Hanging inside, the battered coat w saw Max wear in the subway. A pistol on a hook by the doo Urban armor, scarred by countless nights of service. Max dresses himself for battle, eyes returning to stone.
Max climbs out of the subway into a neighborhood with a f in two worlds: the buildings are old and crumbling, but t shops inside are sleek and expensive. A jarring combinati
ax walks up the street, brushing past HOMELESS PEOPLE and FASHIONISTAS jostling for the same space on the sidewalk.
The hallway is ancient brick, but the doors are pristine steel. Pausing at one with a dozen locks, Max KNOCKS. The door cracks.    An EYE appears.   Squinting, evaluati
You can't come here anymore.
William Preston was a dead end.
The door cracks enough to reveal the speaker: TREVOR, ski fat in an sharp suit and sunglasses, shirt open a little
You can't come here, I said. I'm done helping you. I've already... (lowering his voice) ...paid my debt to society, you know? I've cooperated enough.
We need to talk.   Won't take long. T I
Max follows Trevor inside. The narrow brick entry opens i a cutting-edge loft beyond, filled with modern art and a gathering of BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE milling around enjoying it.
I thought you found Bill's partner.
I did, but Doug only wanted to talk about pigeons, or something. I need a new name, someone robbing houses to feed a habit around that same time.

Three years is a lifetime for guys like that. One way or the other, they're probably all gone now. (a little self-satisfied) Either way, I'm not the one to ask anymore. I cater to a better class, now.
One of the guests catches Max's eye: NATASHA, young and beautiful, returns his gaze for an extra moment and smile
I can see that.
This is a party. These are my friends. You remember friends?
I need another name, or I start frisking your friends.
Trevor stands his ground, not flinching at Max's threat.
don't have one to give you, Max. Look, you've gone through all your living leads, now you're running out of dead ones... (beat) I don't think this guy's out there.
Max nods, fatigue fighting the determination in his eyes.
ry sleeping at night every now and then, you'd see that for yourself.
Y T
Max doesn't answer. His eyes have drifted back to Natasha She plucks a drink from a passing tray, revealing a dark smudge across the inside of her wrist as she does.
I'd invite you in, but...
Suddenly intent, Max pushes past Trevor and into the loft
hanks.
Max weaves through the party towards Natasha, out of plac his utilitarian clothes. She looks up as he gets closer..
ou decided to stay for a while.
She speaks with a Russian accent - smiling, a little nerv Rather than answering, Max's eyes drop to her wrist.
ow it's your turn to say something...
ax takes her hand, gently turning it to reveal her tattoo black wing, stylized feathers tracing faint blue veins.
That's interesting.
Thank you. It's... (glancing past Max) Shit.

Max follows her gaze to the front door, where Trevor is nervously greeting another new arrival: MONA SAX. She's striking, beautiful but also a little frightening. It doesn't hurt that she's flanked by BODYGUARDS. Russian Mo Seeing Natasha standing with Max, Mona barrels across the room towards them. People stand aside to let her pass. ithout preamble, Mona begins YELLING at Natasha in Russia Natasha RESPONDS in kind, clearly intimidated by Mona. Abruptly, Mona grabs Natasha's arm, jerking her off balan
Why don't you let go--
(in perfect English) Mind your business.
Mona returns to Natasha, dragging her towards the door. Natasha's tone becomes PLEADING, physically no match for Mona. Max steps in, reaching up to touch Mona's shoulder.

t happens in a flash: Mona spins and takes hold of Max's arm. Incredibly, he's just as fast, slipping free of the grip that would surely have snapped his wrist... For a moment, Max and Mona stare each other down. Surpris reevaluating each other. Natasha continues to TALK, her Russian anxious as Mona's bodyguards push through the cro Mona's eyes drop to Max's chest, where the tussle pulled coat open to reveal a low-pro holster and tarnished badge With the flick of her wrist, Mona stops her guards' advan The crowd begins to notice the altercation. Natasha keeps TALKING, trying desperately to make peace and reassure Mo of something. Mona's eyes cut between Natasha and Max... till apprehensive, Mona shakes her head and walks away.
My sister. (beat) Sort of a bitch.
As Max nods at the understatement, Trevor rushes over, forcing a broad smile to reassure his guests. He pulls Ma coat closed over the badge and ushers him towards the doo
You have to go. Now.
(pulling free) Fine. I just want to ask her something first...
Max turns to the spot where Natasha had been.   She's gon
The party has grown more crowded. Max fights his way down dark hall, searching the shadowed faces he passes. Back here, the music is nothing but GROWLING BASS.
A flickering glow escapes the gaps around one door...

A ring of candles in the center of the floor provides the only light. It's not enough to really see the PEOPLE insi We hear them CHANTING, low voices MURMURING in unison... Quick glimpses in the candle light, bare flesh writhing. Cast on the walls, corresponding shadows twist and shift. A black feather billows across the floor between candles. Spreading up the wall, a new shadow rises above the rest. pair of wings - long and distorted in the candle light. Max appears in the doorway as the shadows loose their sha Max only catching a glimpse, not sure what he's seeing...

As Max strains to see detail in the dark room, a face materializes in the haze: cheeks laced with tattoos, eyes twinkling flames sunk in deep shadow. JACK LUPINO. uddenly, Max turns and sees Natasha standing beside him. immediately notice something different about her: staring boldly into Max's eyes, all her earlier shyness vanished.
Looking for me?
Natasha glances through the door at the shifting shadows, smiling at what she sees. Max follows her eyes...
Were you in there?
(shrugging, coy) Take me somewhere, I'll tell you.

Max leads Natasha inside. Before he can even shut the doo Natasha pounces - kissing, hands running over his body. A he pushes back, Natasha's hands slip into Max's pockets.. Abruptly, Natasha breaks away and looks around the apartm
You just move in? I T
Not really interested, Natasha walks deeper into the room
hree years ago. So we're somewhere, now: who was that guy--
In response, Natasha unbuckles her pants and lets them dr Still walking, opening her shirt on her way out of the ro
Max moves down the hallway, following a trail of clothing From inside a room, we hear the faint sound of CHANTING..
In Max's bed, a thin sheet barely covers Natasha's body. lips tremble with a slurred SONG. With predatory eyes, sh watches Max stop in the doorway, something holding him ba
(frustrated sigh) Fine. What was her name?
Who?
The girl from the boring story you want tell me. The one that ends with you living here. Very sad.
Caught off guard, Max tries to figure out how much he'll Natasha resumes CHANTING as she waits - a stream of frant SYLLABLES rattling off, nothing recognizable as words.
tell you what... (beat, evil smile) Call me by her name.
(startled) What?
Natasha grins, legs spreading, sheet starting to fall awa
That way you can make love to her again, just like she never left you. (shrill, mocking voice) Oh, Max, I miss you...
Y
Like a switch, Max's face closes off again.
You should go.
Excuse me?
(exhausted, to himself) There's nothing you can tell me.
Natasha explodes out of the bed, springing up naked in fr of Max - shoulders heaving with rage, eyes wild black hol
ou're kicking me out of your bed?
For a moment, it seems like Natasha is about to attack. physically intimidated, Max stares at her in disbelief.
Yeah.
Natasha stomps into the hall, gathering her clothes. She pulls a cell phone from her crumpled pants and dials...
(on phone) Owen, pick up if you're awake...
Max watches her disappear down the hall, front door SLAMM a moment later. He looks around, silence returning again.

Natasha walks down a dark, desolate block, the sound of h HEELS echoing off of the crumbling buildings around her. eyes are still wild, her stride quick and aggressive. A group of MEN huddle in a stairway to avoid the wind. As Natasha passes, they look up at her with equally wild eye atasha steps off the sidewalk and into an alley, plunging into the darkness like she's been there many times before In the distance, faint MUSIC rumbles through the street. moment later, the few working lamps on the street dim... N
Natasha barrels down the alley, squinting to see ahead. music is a little louder, BASS shaking the dumpsters.

wind picks up, garbage blowing... Suddenly unsettled by something, Natasha's pace slows. tenses, all her swagger vanishing before our eyes... can RATTLES in the alley behind her.    Natasha spins... Nothing - just the FLICKERING of moths swarming the alley only light, their shadows black shapes against the bricks The sound of much larger BEATING WINGS fills the alley... Eyes wide with terror, Natasha searches for something in shapes cast by the moths, dread deepening as she finds it eal winged shapes mix with the shadows, FLAPPING wildly.. Natasha CRIES OUT, stumbling back.      She turns, runnin
ot yet!   Please, just let me...
Natasha's SCREAMS seem lost in the chaos of wind and WING and distant MUSIC. She suddenly stops running... More SHADOWS assemble ahead of her, their black wings ope
Max hurriedly dresses, wearing the same suit from yesterd He picks up his keys, searching around for something else feeling the pockets of his jacket, down in the cushions..
Max moves up the sidewalk, nearly at the steps of his off A rough-running ENGINE idles up the street, getting close Slowly, Max realizes that he's being followed. He turns..

LEX HILLMAN sits behind the wheel - about Max's age, but much rougher condition, everything about him a little ash He watches Max turn away from the office and move closer. Max returns Alex's stare. We don't know if they're about smile or open fire. They don't seem to know, either. Alex slides over and throws the passenger side door open. S

Alex and Max ride in silence, a palpable tension in the c lex pulls a pack of cigarettes from his pocket and shakes one out. He holds the pack out to Max, who shakes his hea Alex nods, smiling, using his lighter and then laying it the pack within Max's reach. Max doesn't even glance down After a silent moment, Alex looks over at Max and frowns.
You're not serious, are you?
Shaking his head in disbelief, Alex pulls to the curb.
hey've parked at a crime scene - the alley in front of th sealed with police tape, COPS posted to keep onlookers aw
What's this?
Alex pulls a flask from under his seat, taking a quick pu
I need you to look at something.

Alex approaches the alley, pulling on a leather jacket an snapping a badge onto his belt. The cops let him pass. Max follows Alex, slowing as he crosses the police tape. the crowd of CSI TECHS, what started here didn't end well There's blood everywhere, a dozen white sheets on the gro
What happened to them?
Her.     Just one.
Confused, Max studies the sheets. On second look, they aren't covering anything quite big enough to be a whole b
omebody found her leg near the sidewalk, called it in a few hours later. We found the other one in the dumpster over there.
I don't believe it.
Max and Alex turn to see that they've attracted spectator the other DETECTIVES D the alley watching them intently. in
Don't tell me you two are gonna start working together again. I'd--
(ignoring) What do we know?
Only that it didn't happen here. Beyond that, I don't even know how to describe it in my report. `Disassembled,' that's the word we came up with.
The Detective grins, proud of his wit. Alex and Max move without comment. Max looks at the sheets, shaking his hea
Why are you showing me this?
Alex pulls out a plastic evidence bag, holding it out... Max's wallet.
We found it here, by her heart.
Inside the clear bag, Max's ID picture is smeared with bl
As far as we know, the victim--
(quiet) Natasha.
ax kneels down over a tarp. The edge is pulled back, revealing a pale forearm with a delicate tattoo of a wing
(remembering) They couldn't lift him up...
What did you just say?
Max looks up at Alex, who is suddenly quite agitated. He glances back at the other detectives - they're staring at Alex and Max, whispering something amongst themselves.
We need to talk, Max. Tonight. (writing something) Here's my address...
For God's sake, I know where you--
(somber) No, I moved out.
Alex hands over the address and hurries away, leaving Max standing in the alley, surrounded by Natasha's remains.
Max steps out of his car, moving up the sidewalk to a surprisingly nice apartment building: uniformed doorman, works. Double-checking the address, Max steps inside...
Near the end of the hall, Max stops at an apartment door. The wood is splintered, pieces of the frame hanging loose orced open. Max checks the hall in both directions, drawing his pisto
Careful not to make a sound, Max steps into a living room messy that it's hard to say for sure if it's been ransack Max flips a switch by the door, but no lights come on.
Alex?   Are you in here?
Max pauses so his eyes can adjust to the traces of streetlight sneaking through the blinds. He moves deeper.
Pistol ready, Max moves into the kitchen. Dirty dishes, flies swarming around the necks of countless liquor bottl
nseen behind Max's back, the front door pushes closed...
Max creeps down a hallway.   His shoes CRUNCH in somethin

A broken mirror scattered in the hallway, the pieces grow more concentrated towards the dark end of the hall. Max reaches an open doorway.   Cautiously, he sweeps insi In the hallway behind Max, SOMETHING moves in the shadows ax moves deeper into the darkness, gleaming shards of mir grinding underfoot. Something lies in the floor ahead... BODY - legs stretched across the hall, upper torso not visible inside a room. A badge on the belt, a service revolver limp in it's fingers, tattered leather jacket. Alex. At the moment that registers, a NOISE in the hallway behi him sends Max ducking for cover in the doorway beside him Max crouches, gun raised, staring at Alex's motionless bo
Alex!

FOOTSTEPS grow closer...slow, steady... Max uses the fragments of mirror scattered around Alex's legs, each giving a tiny view of the hallway... One piece shows a FIGURE moving closer, shrouded in darkn

nother reflection shows a set of eyes. Frozen. Frantic. It's Alex, staring at Max, seeming to silently beg for he Max looks from the reflection to the legs. There's no way There's no way Alex's head is still attached to his body. Thunderstruck, Max looses track of the shadows moving clo to his hiding spot, unable to pull his eyes away from Ale The Figure lunges out of the shadows, slamming into Max.. The Dark Shape's slashing blows glint in the moonlight, c metal slicing the air faster than Max can fend off...
Max drags himself up the hall, hands slicing on the shard The air echoes with angry VOICES, LAUGHTER and SCREAMS. Blood drips down the walls, shadows teem with movement...
T Y

The FLAPPING grows louder, gusting WIND scattering glass. Max SHOUTS, disoriented, instinctively pushing himself on Alex's eyes, frozen wide, watch as Max crawls closer... Shadows in the air above Max roil with movement. Demonic HOWLS rattle the windows. Max reaches out to Alex... Above them, black wings POUND.
Max's eyes pop open. He lies in a hospital bed, surrounded by flashing machine Beyond the soft WHIR of equipment fans, the room is silen
The E.R. doctor's old man was a patrolman in the 45th. I got him to get you a private room.
In a chair by the bed, BB HENSLEY (50s) watches Max wake BB's face is weathered and hard, but his smile is kind.
our contact information was... pretty out of date, you know, but one of the dispatchers remembered me and your dad riding together back in the day.
Max nods groggily, struggling to find his bearings... Suddenly, something breaks through.
Alex.
BB nods, shivering at the mental image his name produces.
he first unit to respond must've scared them away before they could do the same thing to you. Pretty remarkable, considering your luck.
He was trying to tell me something.
Was he alive when you showed up?   Did you get a look at the guys who--
J
No.   I get Bflashes, but it's...wrong.
I hate to say it, but you need to come up with something better than that. They've got nothing for leads, so the whole force has you pegged as the prime suspect.
You tell them where to find me.
No need.   The funeral starts in an hour.
Max pops up, tangling the IV tubes running into his hand.
ust slow down.   You need to--
Max wraps the clear tube around his hand and SNAPS it fre
What I need is to borrow some dress blues. Can you help me out?
(reluctant) Yeah. My office is on the way.
As Max takes an unsteady step onto the cold tile floor, a concerned BB throws his overcoat across Max's shoulders.
BB and Max ride in silence, RADIO overpowered by the blas heater. Max closes the overcoat over his hospital gown.
--with a major system moving down from Canada tonight, transportation authorities are bracing for a blizzard...
BB pulls against the curb on a block unfamiliar to Max.
A massive stone structure, squat like a military fortress black under the storm clouds. There have been updates ove the years, but nothing could to hide the age of the build
BB starts across the sidewalk to the entrance. Max follow giving a confused frown at the building they're approachi
You quit working for Aesir?
BB leads Max through a wrought-iron gate, into a small courtyard leads back to the thick wood doors of the entra
I didn't quit, they made me head of security for the whole parent company. That comes with its own building, such that it is. beat) Check this out.
A proud parent, BB points at a deep pit in the stone wall
(impatient) It's a bullet hole.
Yeah, from a musket ball. The British used this place as a military prison during the Revolutionary War. Think about that. It's older than St. Paul's.
ax looks up at the crumbling gargoyles perched above.

The double doors fly open onto a massive office - dark wo panelling, a wall of windows glowing white from the snow. Max goes to the windows. Spreading out bellow him, the wi black expanse of the East River rolls past. Bridges arc u into the storm clouds and disappear before they hit Brook
W hen the weather isn't so shitty, the view is unbelievable. (going to the closet) I'm not making any guarantees that any of this will fit.

While BB roots around inside, Max absently scans his desk A slick company newsletter - `AESIR PHARMACEUTICALS.' On the cover, NICOLE HORNE - 50's, dignified, not quite smil `A HOLIDAY MESSAGE FROM THE CEO' printed below her face.
I T T
I saved one of those for you. (off Max's confusion) Third page from the back.
Max flips the pages - smiling scientists, sparkling labs. ICHELLE PAYNE, bright smile illuminating a bland corporat portrait. The same face in the photo Max showed the Junki
hey're going to set up some kind of scholarship in her name.
Taken by surprise, Max doesn't seem to hear BB's explanat
hey kept coming to me for suggestions over what she might want. I guess since we go back so far, maybe they think I'm
family. Nobody knew how to find you... beat) I said art. She liked art, right?
Max nods, turning his eyes away from the photograph.
t's a nice thing, a scholarship.   Good way to remember somebody.
ax eagerly takes the old uniform from BB, happy to have something else to focus on. BB studies his body language.
You still haven't been out there, have you?
Max doesn't answer, slipping into a wrinkled dress shirt.

Cars line the drive leading into the cemetery. People lea their warmth and hurry through the iron gates - these mourners especially determined, a community out to honor fallen brother. BB and Max follow them onto the...
Max's eyes are on the cemetery. BB follows his gaze... Two marble angels on the hill. One smaller than the other
(gently pushing) It's a nice spot. I'll go up there with you after, if you want...
Max shakes his head. Up ahead, a young mother tends to two little girls dresse black, escorted through the cemetery gate by the HONOR GU CHRISTA HILLMAN, Alex's widow. Face blank, still in shock
suddenly anxious) Go ahead up and say something to Christa. I'll find us some seats...

ax threads his way through the mass of UNIFORMED COPS waiting to enter the cemetery. One by one they notice Max jaws clenching. Max doesn't realize the gauntlet he's in, distracted by a glance of BB slinking into the graves... ...where NICOLE HORNE watches the funeral from among the headstones, almost overdressed in head-to-toe black. Clos at hand, JASON COLVIN holds Nicole's umbrella. B approaches Nicole, body language weak and deferential.. Max glances back at the path and finds himself facing a w of angry cops. He keeps walking, no sign of backing down.
Let him through.
Even with the cops making way, the walk to Christa is har the heartbreak and grief on her face slowing Max's gait.
Christa, I'm really sorry about what--
Don't talk to me like some stranger.
Christa's eyes bore into Max with all the weight of a lon and deep friendship, momentarily shaming him into silence
Who did this to him, Max?
We don't have a lot, yet...

Look, Max is like a son to me. Don't put me in a position to have to hang him. (beat, pained) But you should hear the kinds of things he's saying...hallucinations, none of it makes any sense to me. I'm worried he's going to get into another situation before I can convince him to come in.
Are you telling me he was--
I'm telling you to find him tonight, before somebody else gets hurt.
Bravura nods, reeling from the revelation of this new information. BB picks up his coat and starts for the door
Is there anything we can do to help you bring him in? Unofficially, of course...
Bringing him in won't be a problem. Where I need your help will be his--
Why do you say that?
Bravura stands, finishing a note.
A New Jersey unit ID'd him near his old house. It shouldn't be long.
B nods, somberly mulling this over.
You have to find him first, protect him. Some of the guys from Alex's unit beat you to him, they won't wait for a trial.

At the edge of a strip mall, a ramshackle personal storag business sits behind a razor-wire fence. Inside the fence rows of stalls for rent, covered by metal garage doors. here's the faint sound of METAL STRETCHING, and Max is ov the fence. He moves through the rows, reading the numbers A padlock hangs from the door, shining metal glazed over a sheet of ice. Max finds a pristine key on a ring in his pocket. Hands shaking, he cracks the ice and tries...
The garage door raises, cold metal RATTLING as it rolls u Max stands silhouetted in the doorway, looking in on ragg stacks of cardboard boxes. His breath blooming around him

Max steps inside, pulling a box marked `GARAGE' out into light. Opening it, he roots around and finds a flashlight Switched on, a golden beam cuts through the blue shadows. Max walks deeper into the space, brushing the light over boxes. He holds his hand over one, as if warming it... Max opens the box. aiting for him under the flaps, a stuffed animal stares u at Max from inside the box. Silly grin, frozen eyes shini Hands trembling, Max pushes the toy aside. Deeper in the box, he finds a framed picture and pulls it into the ligh The photograph is of Max - younger, cleaner, genuinely smiling. Posed along with him, Olan Mills-style, are Elizabeth and the baby. Gauzy backdrop, church clothes. Max studies it, haggard new face reflecting in the glass. Abruptly, Max jumps up and moves away from the box. Long strides, trying in vain to physically shake the memories, block out the emotions with something productive... The flashlight beam keeps sweeping, deeper and deeper. Ma chokes back tears, occasionally glancing at the baby box. he beam hits on a document box in the back row.   `OFFICE Max rushes over, nearly tipping the other boxes in his hu to throw the lid off the document box. Rows of folders, a
neatly labeled with feminine script. ax brushes his fingers over the tabs, smiling sadly.    E year numbered -- `1998,' `1999,' `2000'...
(to himself) Okay, Chelle. Help me, here...

Max's fingers skim to the last file in the box, marked `2004.' Much thinner than the others. Her last year. Only one file in the final section. Max opens it, finding pages of handwritten notes, photocopies, drawings... Closing the file, he checks the name on the tab and frown

Max steps out of the storage locker. He tucks the manila folder inside his coat and pulls the metal door closed. He starts away, retracing his steps to the fence. Mind reeling with what he's just seen, the memories flooding b There's a second set of footprints in the snow before him Max freezes, their significance immediately registering.
Stay where you are!
A YOUNG COP steps out of the shadows behind Max, pistol trained on the back of his head. The cop's eyes are wide
with panic. He assumes an awkward, textbook firing positi
(turning slowly) Relax, I'm a cop.
Don't move! I know who you are.
he gun stays trained on Max.    Slowly, he raises his han
Just relax. I need you to trust me for a minute...
Yeah? Is that what you said to your partner?
You don't understand.
(gesturing with the gun) Lay down on your face.

Max studies the cop - stiff legs unsteady on the deep sno his frostbitten fingers wrapped around the trigger. Trapp between two rows of locked doors, Max has no cover to run Peeking through the snow at Max's feet, an extension cord snakes under the shivering cop's legs and down the corrid
(bending down) Okay, just take it easy.
Max starts to lay down, causally laying his hand over the power cord. The cop edges closer, smirking as Max complie
Word's gotten around about the sick shit you did to him, too. If I were you, I'd get ready for sort of a long ride back into the city...
Max wraps his hand around the cord and whips it tight... The cop pitches backward, squeezing off a SHOT as he fall Before he can fire again, Max pounces on the cop, driving

knee into his chest and wrenching the pistol away. he cop twists in the extension cord, unplugging the light Max DRIVES the butt of the pistol into the side of his he he cop goes limp. Max pulls the clip, clears the chamber and lets the gun fall in the snow beside the unconscious Struggling to his feet, Max races down the corridor and scaling the icy chain link. He drops into the snow, immediately breaking into a dead run on the other side.

An express elevator HISSES upwards at great speed, the sl interior like a European sports car. Alone inside, Jason Colvin watches the blur of numbers with dread. A muted CHIME, and the doors draw back...

Thin steel beams loft through the air, three stories of o air encased by glass, a silent void projected into the he of the storm. In the center of the room, a single black b It's a desk, obsidian, polished to a mirrored sheen. Aesi International's cool blue logo reflects across its surfac Jason Colvin approaches the desk, nervously watching the shadowed figure of Nicole Horne read through a document. Every hair, every stitch of clothing perfect.
ootsteps ECHOING, he reaches the desk and waits for a bea
We have a problem.
icole cuts her eyes to Colvin - withering, a current of f passing through him. With great effort, she smiles.

Max slumps in his seat, watching the black sky whip past. The manila folder closed in his hands, fingers tracing th edges. Slowly, carefully, he lets the folder fall open. Max's eyes skim across the handwritten notes, lingering o underscored phrases and circled words. Drinking it in. On the next page, a sketch of black wings pulls Max's attention. With dread, he reads a note below the drawing:

head_text.subj: SUBJECTS DESCRIBE DEMONIC VISIONS, HYSTERICAL RAGE...'

text: (to himself) Subjects?

The hypnotic motion of the train begins to change, the rh of the RAILS faltering a little. ax turns the page. More wings, each in a slightly differe style, each version surrounded by descriptive notes... Max skims, excited, as the train's HICCUPS grow worse... As the blue and black world sweeps past outside the windo Max's face softens almost into a smile... All the lights go out.    The train rapidly loses speed..

tartled voices MURMUR. Windows that had been black glow t life as the passengers' eyes adjust to the dark car... utside, the moonless night becomes a hazy expanse of blue snow, covering the embankments along the railroad tracks the broken-down houses in the distance. The darkness changes Max, too, hardening his face again. tucks the folder safely into his coat and zips it up tigh At the front of the car, the windows begin to fill with light. The door opens, a flashlight beam sweeps inside... Pistol between his knees, Max pulls the hammer back...
An obese CONDUCTOR (40s) steps inside. Immediately, all o the other passengers begin to QUESTION HIM at once.
(shouting over) Ladies and gentlemen, please remain calm. The storm's caused a power failure, but it's absolutely nothing to worry about. We'll be up and running again before long.

Movement outside catches Max's eye. A FIGURE in the shado alongside the train. Gravel CRUNCHES. Voices WHISPER. CONDUCTOR (cont'd) Our policy is to move everyone up to the front car until the lights come on again. It'll be a little warmer if we're all together...

ax splits his attention between the other passengers and window, watching for more movement outside... Suddenly, the Figure breaks in the opposite direction - n attempt at quiet, a POUNDING run away from the train. onfused, Max straightens up.    The temperature has chang THREE MORE FIGURES, running in the opposite direction. from the train, up the snowy tracks it's yet to cross.
(recognizing) Get out of the train.
PASSENGERS fill the aisle. High school girls sneaking int the city... An old man going to work... Drunk yuppies in and green scarves, on their way back from a Holiday party
(shouting) Get out--
An EXPLOSION rips through the front of the car and swells ball of fire smashing through the car and blowing it apar
Up and down the dark street, shadowed GHOULS break window and claw at abandoned cars, searching for anything of val

Moving comfortably through the shadows, Mona follows the general movement towards a BASSY QUAKE farther up the blo A red neon `RAGNA ROK' bloodies the snow in the air, mark the entrance to the club responsible for the RUMBLE...

Inside, that music is EARSPLITTING - a jet engine at 200 beats per minute. Lights strobe past red gels, frozen glimpses of thin limbs and black pupils on the dance floo ona melts into a corner, inconspicuously watching the roo inding around the dance floor, CLUBGOERS - some ragged, s in nice clothes - queue at a metal door in the back wall. One after another, they wait for their moment to enter... There's a disturbance at the front door. Black-clad Guard force open a rift in the crowd on the dance floor... Jack Lupino walks inside the rift - his tattooed face red black, eyes calmly sweeping out across the riotous crowd.
Lupino moves through bodies roiling like a parted sea, sh walls of twisting flesh towering above him to the rafters Mixed within, the wings POUND and SWEEP, blotting the lig Hell.
BB crawls out from under the quilts, careful not to wake WIFE. He passes windows frosted with ice, on his way to..
BB shuffles down the hall, shivering in his boxers. He pauses at the thermostat, frowning to find the heat cut o
B turns, startling as Max steps out of the shadows - step stiff with pain, clothes dripping icy water across the fl
(terrified) Max? What are you doing?
Max opens his coat and pulls out the file, now badly wrin and soggy. He opens it and hands BB a newspaper clipping.
I
Those grunts who went crazy in Iraq?
Go a little further, read what they did to the bodies. It's the same as what happened to Alex and that girl.
BB reads on, frowning.
Where did you get this?
Michelle.
BB looks up, startled, as Max pages through Michelle's no

It's all in her notes: people describing fevers, hallucinations...their lymph nodes swell until their necks bruise like something's been choking them. (pointing to the drawings) The angels they all talk about? Michelle talks about eye spasms that make things seem to flutter. Mixed with the other delusions, that starts looking like wings... (beat) She wasn't seeing them. She was trying to figure out why other people were.
thought she was working on allergy medicines.
Somebody at Aesir knows what--
(thunderstruck) Oh, my God.
Slowly, BB turns to show Max the grief in his eyes.
It's me.    I killed Alex. B Y
What are you talking about?

He came to me about six months ago, asking about one of the executives at Aesir. At the time I had no reason to connect it to Michelle, I just thought... (beat, torn up) I tried to warn him, this guy has connections to some scary people--
Who?   What's his name?
BB hesitates, rattled by the rage in Max's eyes.
Jason Colvin. He used to be the head of the pharmaceutical division, but he's moved up over the last few years. (beat) I guess Michelle probably reported directly to him...
Max barely nods, jaw clenched as he scoops up the documen
ou've got copies of this stuff, right?
Thinking for a moment, Max sets the folder down again and turns away towards the dark hallway. BB picks up the fold
e careful, Max.
Max doesn't respond, storming off into the shadows.
The snow isn't deep near the charred and twisted metal of train, melted by the fireball. Police tape rings the area
ETECTIVES wander between yellow tarps in the train, sippi coffee. Out on the tracks, Bravura works alone.
Looks like ten bodies, give or take. Even in New York, that ought to be enough to earn Payne the spike.
B
The blast point is outside the train.
None of the detectives want to encourage him by answering
ased on the spread of the wreckage... they moving very fast, either.
He forced them to stop, first.
Bravura nods at the explanation, but without conviction. continues to scan the wreckage, still not satisfied...
So he had the bomb with him inside, but he decided to walk outside to detonate it?
Are you asking if that seems like odd behavior from a guy who cut his partner's head off?
The Young Cop from the storage building slips down the sn bank and towards Bravura. His face is bruised and swollen
You wanted to see me?
Careful what you say to him, if you ever want to make detective...
(to Bravura, guarded) I already filled out a report.
Bravura sees the Young Cop aware of the detective's prese
Show me where it happened, then.
Bravura and the Young Cop stand on the spot where he foug Max the night before - disturbed snow, the frayed cord...
He jumped out and wrapped that cord around me, and before I had a chance... I
Bravura nods at the bullshit, focus drawn to Max's locker
(pointing) He was coming out of here?
When the Young Cop nods, Bravura starts to step inside.
Hey, real cops are working here...

A few CSI TECHS take photographs of Max's storage locker. Bravura walks through, eyes quickly scanning the distract jumble of boxes. The Homicide Cop follows, exasperated. t the back, Bravura stops and picks something up. It's th lid of the box, `OFFICE' written in Michelle's pen. Bravura looks around. There's no document box to match th lid. However, there are dust-free rectangles in the dirt.
(to a CSI tech) Where's the stuff you guys moved?
Nothing's been moved.
What, you playing detective now?
On a mission, Bravura scans the rest of the room. He sees another open box, a colorful stuffed animal peeking out. Bravura opens it, startled by the family portrait.
(studying the photo) This is his wife?
Bravura finally looks up to see the Homicide cop smirking
spent four hours up at Homicide going through Alex's desk and cataloging pictures of this woman, and not one of you bastards bothered to mention that she was Max Payne's wife?
(shrugging) If Alex was getting a little something on the side--
Who are you protecting?
Bravura charges closer, carrying enough force that the mu larger Homicide Cop steps back. His cool facade crumbles.
Nobody, we just...why would anybody talk to IA without a reason?
(livid) You've got a reason, now. Tell me everything you know about this woman, starting with her name.

The city is starting to shut down under the relentless sn the sidewalks are nearly empty, only cabs on the icy stre The Aesir corporate offices gleam in the diffuse light, a pillar of glass and steel disappearing up into the storm.
Jason Colvin steps out of a cab and marches up the steps.
Stepping off of the elevator, Colvin passes a RECEPTIONIS
You should go on home, already.   There's nothing going on today...
Well, there's someone in your office...
Colvin steps through the doorway and stops short. Max stands behind Colvin's desk, inspecting the photograp hanging on the wall. He's cleaned himself up a little.
(pointing to a photo) This your daughter?
N
Yes, it is. Three years old.
For reasons Colvin can't fathom, Max's mood seems to dark even farther. Colvin sees the badge clipped to his belt.
Is there something I can help you with, detective?
You can tell me about Project Valhalla.
(nervous laugh) I think you might have the wrong...
Barely keeping his poker face, Colvin eyes the phone.
eed to make a call?
Maybe I'd better.
Max motions for Colvin to go ahead. While the executive's shaking hands dial the number, Max closes and LOCKS the d
Yes, there's a detective here... to Max) What did you say your name was?
Max.
Abruptly, Max RIPS the phone cord out of the wall.
(low) She was my wife.
The words, Max's flat delivery, catch Colvin like ice wat Still holding the dead receiver, Colvin staggers back...
(stunned) Excuse me?
Michelle Payne was my wife.
What color there was to begin with drains out of Colvin.
What--
Before you say anything else, I want you to know who I am.
Please, wait...
Max throws his elbow up, CRUSHING Colvin's nose.
Bravura enters the soaring lobby of the Aesir building, stomping his shoes clean. He approaches the front desk.
(flashing his badge) I need to talk to somebody about a woman who used to work here.

Colvin's eyes flutter open.   His nose is smashed flat. He's being held upright by his belt, which loops around h neck and the headrest of his ergonomic chair. His wrists bound to the armrests with strips of his tie. Max sits on the edge of the desk, heavy lamp in his hand.
(weakly, eyeing the lamp) Please don't hit me again.
Max wraps the cord in his hand and jerks it free from the lamp, which he tosses with a CRASH. The cord, he keeps.
A week ago, I thought the universe had turned against me. Everything I loved was gone, and for some reason I'd been left here to suffer alone.
Max strips back the insulation on the cord, exposing two frizzed bundles of wire: one brass, the other silver. Positive and negative. Colvin watches, apprehensive.
B
ut it wasn't the universe that took my family away from me.
Max plugs in the cord.
It was you.
He crouches by Colvin, wire in each hand, moving them clo
Tell me about Valhalla.
Colvin struggles to pull away from the approaching wires.
There is no--
Max brushes the bare wires against Colvin's throat. here's a bright SPARK.       Colvin SCREAMS.
Tell me.
There's no Project Valhalla anymore.   I shut it down years ago.
A timid KNOCKING starts on Colvin's door, VOICES calling Max waits for more, eyes frozen, wires hanging ready.

(reluctant) It was a disaster. The drug was so addictive, the damage it did to the mind was so devastating that we lost our government funding. By the end, we couldn't even guarantee the safety of our scientists administering the experiment. Test subjects would follow them home and kill them for an extra dose.
Is that what happened to Michelle?
Nobody knows what happened to her.
Max picks up a cup of coffee from the desk and pours it o Colvin's face as he struggles more frantically.
Max brings the wires closer to Colvin's wet skin.
terrified) People thought Michelle might be a whistle-blower. That she wasn't loyal enough to Aesir, and she might go public about the program.
Max's eyes thaw, hit by the first true words about her de

Bravura sits in the lobby, impatiently skimming a magazin On the far side of the enormous room, movement draws his A line of black-clad SECURITY GUARDS swiftly moving in formation into a stairwell. SWAT precision, heavy hardwar Bravura springs up, approaching the Guards left at the do
Authorized personnel only.
Bravura pulls out his badge, and plans to keep moving... But the guards don't immediately part. They look at each other, silently conferring. Bravura's eyes light up.
Don't look at him.    Move aside. (louder) I 'm authorized.
Max lets the wires fall away.   Solemnly, he draws his pi
Why are you asking me about this?
I already told you.    Be quiet, now.
Max chambers a round, leaving his hand up to block the sp
But why today? It's over, I got rid of everything before they moved me out of the division--
Then you haven't been Downtown lately, because you missed a spot.
Colvin looks up, Max's words suddenly scarier than the gu
Are you telling me that there are people out there taking the drug again? urgent) How many of them?
Max shakes his head.    Colvin's eyes show real terror.
I knew it, I knew something was going on. I told her the numbers were too good--
The POUNDING outside the door is louder, more VOICES call
(calling through the door) Mr. Colvin, are you okay in there? Security's on its way...
Max turns to the door - trapped, ready to fire on what co through. Colvin looks at Max, a sudden realization dawnin
They're not coming for you.
What are you talking about?
Colvin begins to struggle harder than ever, but his fear isn't directed at the man with the gun standing over him.
You only know my name because somebody high up decided to cut me loose. (gesturing) There's a safe in the wall. It's open.
earing a trap, Max pushes aside a painting and pulls open the door. A small stack of DVDs sits inside.
Show that to whoever will watch. If this thing spreads, nothing will keep the rest of you safe.
Max looks at the middle manager, desire to pull the trigg slowly losing out to the credibility of Colvin's story. Max unfastens the belt, using it to hoist Colvin to his f
(terrified) Wait, I'm not ready...
OFFICE WORKERS draw back and GASP as Colvin's bloody face appears. Max is close behind, holding the belt around Colvin's neck, pressing his pistol to the back of his hea
Back up, all of you.   Make a path.
There's a disturbance at the back of the crowd - glimpses black uniforms fighting forward. The Guards. Max pivots, holding Colvin towards the Guards as a shield
calling to the guards) Stay back, or I'll--
CRACK!    Colvin's head snaps back, blood spraying over M

he crowd goes crazy, SCREAMING and trampling each other.. More SHOTS ring out, ripping through Colvin as Max lets h lifeless body fall and hides his retreat in the scramble. The Guards chase after Max, slowed by the panicking crowd
Exhausted, Bravura plods up steps to a landing. Suddenly, AUTOMATIC WEAPONS erupt nearby. He fumbles for a cell pho

This is Jim Bravura, IA. You need to tell the units responding to the Aesir call to come equipped for automatic-- (frowning) The Aesir building, nobody's called anything in yet? (beat) Hell yes, I'd like to report something. We've got machine gun fire in Midtown.
Bravura snaps his phone shut, trying to regulate his brea Drawing a tiny service revolver he creeps to the door...

Max stumbles up the hall. He chances a look back at the black-clad GUARDS crashing through office workers... A BURST of machine gun fire POUNDS the floor in front of Max's feet. More Guards seal off the hall ahead. Nowhere else to go, Max grips a cubicle wall and vaults over...

ax gets a few careful SHOTS off from his new elevation, dropping Guards who've lost sight of him as he jumps from desk to desk, working deeper into the maze of cubicles... The fastest Guards race ahead to block off a burning `EXI sign. Max's boots THUNDER across desks, papers flying... The Guards ahead FIRE, but Max shows now sign of slowing. Overhead lights EXPLODE, smoke and sparks raining down... Max launches himself into the air, pistol CRACKING as he falls. Bullets RIP through the retreating Guards... Max hits the ground hard, scrambling through the exit...
...and around the corner.
(shouting) Put your hands up!
Max slides to a stop, startled to see Bravura aiming at h While he doesn't exactly comply, Max does lower the barre
(more human) You need to come in now, before anything else gets pinned on you.
ax shakes his head.       HEAVY BOOT STEPS rumble closer.
She was trying to stop it.
Stop what?     Tell me what's happening--
Bullets STRAFE the wall just above Max's head. He dives t the ground, plaster dust and smoke pluming above him.
hile Max scrambles for cover, Bravura charges forward, waving his badge in the air above him.
NYPD!   Hold your fire!
uards flow into the hall, a black mass bristling FIRE. It takes a split second for Bravura to realize they aren't stopping. He slips, tumbling back as bullets RIP past him
(screaming) Hold your fire!
Finally, the machine guns go quiet. Smoldering gunpowder clouds the hallway. Bravura and the Guards search... ..but Max has disappeared into the smoke.

Mona struggles up a narrow street, buffeted by the wind. Ahead, flashing blue and red lights electrify the snow. squad car idles towards her, searchlight flashing into da shadows. Mona ducks her head away as the spotlight finds at her building door. For a moment, she's in a whiteout. lowly, the cop car moves on. Mona starts to use her key.. but the lock has already been forced open.
Mona steps inside, ready for ambush.    She turns the cor Max sits on her couch, scraped and scorched from his esca
(pointing to the TV) You need to see this.
Over black, the Aesir corporate logo flashes up, quickly replaced by a simple block-letter title card:
From the beginning of time, great generals have all wrestled with one undeniable truth - morale wins battles.
ver an up-tempo ROCK SOUNDTRACK, a slick montage of war imagery: tanks roaring over sand dunes, missiles ripping through palace walls, American troops firing machine guns
Fear, fatigue, loss of focus...the future of combat medicine lies in the mind of the soldier.
A cutting-edge lab, SCIENTISTS working complex machinery.
Thanks to breakthroughs made by Aesir Pharmaceuticals, the military of tomorrow will be able of unlock the limitless potential inside every soldier.

n screen, the shot cuts to the interview of a YOUNG SOLDI in uniform. He smiles easily, confident, eyes alert but maybe a little distant. Something familiar about him... H         YOUNG SOLDIER (V.O.) ow has my experience in combat changed since being selected for Project Valhalla? (beat, smiling) I'm never scared, for starters.
uperimposed under his face: `PVT. JACK LUPINO.' tartled, Mona moves closer to the screen.
That's the guy.
What are you talking about?
He's the one behind Ragna Rok. It's his club where the drug's being sold.
You face down a group of insurgents and instead of fear, you're filled with...peace, I guess.
(2)      LUPINO(CONT'D) Like you're aware of the power you have in your own hands to make the world a better place.
Max studies Lupino's image - thinner, no visible tattoos. All-American. There's already something in his eyes, thou As Mona sits back down, Max brushes past her to get his c
So what do we do now?
Max stands up from the couch and starts away. Confused, M tries to follow, but stumbles when something pulls her ba he looks down to see she's been handcuffed to her chair.
What are you doing? (beat, louder) Uncuff me. (beat, louder still) Hey!

On screen, Lupino smiles, beads of sweat forming on his f Deliberately, Max stops the DVD and cuts off the televisi W         MONA hat is this? You think just because he killed your partner, you can decide whether I--
When Max finally speaks, the sound scrapes out of his thr like he hasn't used his voice in years:
He killed my wife.
Mona struggles at the cuff, chain CLANKING but holding.
I've been inside that club.   You don't have a chance on your own. (realizing) But you don't care.
Max stoops down to pick up Mona's machine gun where it le against the base of the couch. Mona THRASHES helplessly.
You don't want my help, because you think if he puts you out of your misery, you'll get to see her again.
Without a look back, Max starts out the door.
I hope that's really the way it works.
The door pulls shut behind him.
The red neon sign is only an ember, muted under caked ice n a chair blocking the front door, a GUARD watches the silent street, shivering uncontrollably.
Inside, the dance floor is empty. Sitting at the top of t stairs, another GUARD sleeps, rifle propped beside him.

A room like the inside of a smoker's lung - walls painted black, haze from candles and whatever else blurring the a Jack Lupino sits on the floor surrounded by candles, watc the flames with manic focus. Two GUARDS stand above him.
nto a bent spoon, Lupino taps greenish powder from a smal glass vial. He uses the candle to heat the spoon. Checkin his watch, one of the guards produces a cell phone and di
(on phone) All quiet, 4 a.m.
Lupino dips a needle into the spoon, drawing the bubbling green liquid into the body of the syringe.
The guard stomps his feet, trying in vain to keep some bl flowing. Blowing in his hands, he looks both ways down a street that is still just as empty as it has been for hou
(chattering, to himself) Screw this...
Frozen fingers fumbling with the keys, the Guard opens th door. Moving the chair just inside the doorway, the guard settles in the alcove...
He pulls the door shut. It won't. Something's blocking it The guard stands up, opens it wider to build some momentu Max stands on the top step.

Lupino shoots up, gritted teeth tugging his belt tourniqu tight. Eyes clinched, beads of sweat already forming. The muffled BLAST of a machine gun, out on the dance floo The Guards surrounding Lupino spring into action.
W ait here, Mr. Lupino.
Lupino lets the belt slip free, a deep SIGH rattling out. opens his eyes, just in time for us to see the irises retracting. Candles shine in the black holes left behind.
I don't need protection.   I have my own.
The Guards at the door lock and load, moving out...

Max walks into the ballroom, motionless Guard bleeding ou the dance floor before him. Gunsmoke hangs in the air... In that final stillness, Max checks his clip.     Stone-f Thundering BOOTS echo out from the belly of the building. Doors fly open - Guards racing out from the kitchen on th first floor, two more from the office CRASHING out upstai ax OPENS UP, flames of automatic fire lighting his way.

Lupino and the Guards listen to the SHOOTING grow closer. Suddenly, the metal door flies open, BANGING at the stop. With lightning reflexes, THE GUARDS BLAST down the hallwa upino slowly stands, eyes glowing in the guard's muzzle flash. Forgotten now, he fades away into the smoke. The Guards crumble and fall until the room goes SILENT.
ax melts out of the smoke, weapon raised.     Hunting.
C

The back room is deeper than the poor light gives away. Max's boots grind over burned-out candles, occult runes.. Lupino launches out of the darkness at Max.   Before he s it coming, Lupino drives a hard punch into Max's skull. Max stumbles forward, ears ringing from the blow. Lupino draws a gleaming knife from his boot and springs on Max. upino swings the knife so quickly it becomes a blur, blad WHISTLING as it cuts through the smoke. He slashes the kn across Max's thigh, dropping him to the ground. nable to stand, Max thrusts the rifle up for protection.
